attributes.comment:
I am writing to oppose this fee increase, due to the high costs already incurred
and will incur. I am married to a Ukrainian citizen, and was required to pay fees of
$170 for a petition for fiancee, along with $70.00 for biometrics fee. After marrying
I had to apply for alien registration $350.00 + $70.00 for biometrics fee again,
because of delays in the process I was told that it was over a year since the
original fingerprints were taken, and so they had to be taken again. So far it has
cost $660.00 X 2 because my wife has a minor son who accompanied her to the
United States. This summer I will have to pay again for an adjustment of status
and probably the biometrics again which at the moment the fees are $350.00 +
$70.00 X 2 = $840.00. So in order to marry a non U.S. citizen and bring her and
her son to the United States will cost me in excess of $1080.00 X 2 = $2,160.00
and that is just to become a legal resident. If these fees go into effect, then the
government should provide an itemized invoice to show where the funds were
appropriated. How many background investigations does the government need to
do on an individual. The costs for followup investigations due to adjusting status
should not cost the same as an original background check, therefore making the
increase in all fees disproportionate
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By John J. Davis
